claim: The Israeli Institute for Biological Research has completed the task of developing a vaccine to treat coronavirus.
label: Misleading

claim: Five people died in Tarlac after getting vaccinated against COVID-19.
label: FALSE

claim: Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times in August 2020 claim that five people in the Philippine city of Tarlac died after receiving vaccine shots.
label: FALSE

claim: Would you take a vaccine with a 33% death rate to feel safe from a virus with a 0.06% death rate?
label: FALSE

claim: Georgian citizens are “experimental rabbits” for the UK vaccine
label: MISLEADING

claim: The WHO has acknowledged that the vaccines are dangerous.
label: FALSE

claim: If parents refuse to accept COVID-19 testing and vaccination, their children will be taken away. Training sessions are now being held for 200 social workers, judges and other civil servants for this purpose.
label: MISLEADING

claim: Chinese-made COVID-19 vaccines have microchips that allow 5G tracking
label: FALSE

claim: The novel coronavirus has many mutations and strains. Hence, the development of the vaccine is pointless.
label: MISLEADING

claim: Moderna’s vaccine is dangerous. Moreover, the company is related to Anthony Fauci and Bill Gates.
label: FALSE

claim: COVID-19 vaccines will cause infertility – do not get vaccinated
label: FALSE

claim: Procuders of vaccines are freed from liabilities if there are side effects
label: FALSE

claim: Chinese vaccines contain a microchip that receives 5G signals and allow Chinese government to interfere with your RNA
label: FALSE

claim: 80% of the people who participated in the Moderna’s COVID-19 vaccine trial fell ill
label: MISLEADING

claim: We can’t make a vaccine that works for flu, no vaccine for the respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), and we can’t cure cancer. Yet somehow scientists can make a vaccine for COVID-19 in six months?
label: FALSE
